summary: This is an email chain from March 2021 regarding the drafting of the U.S. government's opposition to a third bail application in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It involves coordination between prosecutors and the Office of International Affairs (OIA) concerning sections on France and citizenship renunciation, with a filing deadline of Tuesday.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email on March 7, 2021, who attached a draft opposition to Ghislaine Maxwell's third bail application and is coordinating review with the Office of International Affairs.

events.title: Drafting of Third Bail Opposition
events.description: Prosecutors are preparing and reviewing a draft opposition to Ghislaine Maxwell's third bail application, with specific sections pending feedback from the Office of International Affairs regarding France and citizenship renunciation.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from March 2021 concerning the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Prosecutors were drafting an opposition to Maxwell's third bail application, indicating ongoing legal proceedings.
The draft required review by the Office of International Affairs (OIA) for sections related to France and citizenship renunciation.
The filing deadline for the opposition was Tuesday, March 9, 2021, showing time-sensitive legal work.
